question: Who are all the employees in the Engineering department?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."department") IN ('engineering')))

question: How many managers do we have in our company?
sql: SELECT "t1"."is_manager", COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") AS "total" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND ("t1"."is_manager" = 1)) GROUP BY "t1"."is_manager" ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") DESC

question: Which employees are located in New York?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."location") IN ('new york')))

question: List all employees who report to Sarah Johnson.
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."reports_to_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (("t1"."is_active" AND ("t2"."full_name" LIKE '%sarah%')) AND ("t2"."full_name" LIKE '%johnson%'))

question: Who has their birthday coming up in the next month?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND (date("t1"."start_date") > date('now'))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-31')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-03-31'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-31')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%birthday%'))

question: Which employees are assigned to the Marketing client?
sql: SELECT "t1"."full_name", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."client") IN ('marketing')))

question: How many employees do we have in each department?
sql: SELECT "t1"."department", COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") AS "total" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE "t1"."is_active" GROUP BY "t1"."department" ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") DESC

question: Who are the active employees in the Sales department?
sql: SELECT "t1"."full_name", "t1"."is_active" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."department") IN ('sales')))

question: List all employees who are managers in the Finance department.
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE (("t1"."is_active" AND ("t1"."is_manager" = 1)) AND (LOWER("t1"."department") IN ('finance')))

question: Which employees are based in remote locations?
sql: SELECT "t1"."full_name", "t1"."location" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."location") IN ('remote')))

question: Which employees have birthdays between April and June?
sql: SELECT "t1"."full_name", "t1"."birth_date" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE (("t1"."is_active" AND ((CAST(strftime('%m', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') > 4) OR ((CAST(strftime('%m', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') = 4) AND (CAST(strftime('%d', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') >= 1)))) AND ((CAST(strftime('%m', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') < 6) OR ((CAST(strftime('%m', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') = 6) AND (CAST(strftime('%d', "t1"."birth_date"), 'INTEGER') <= 30))))

question: How many employees are assigned to each client?
sql: SELECT "t1"."client", COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") AS "total" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE "t1"."is_active" GROUP BY "t1"."client" ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") DESC

question: List all employees in the HR department who are also managers.
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE (("t1"."is_active" AND ("t1"."is_manager" = 1)) AND (LOWER("t1"."department") IN ('hr')))

question: Who are our employees in the London office?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."updated_at", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."nationality", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_manager", "t1"."location", "t1"."linkedin", "t1"."twitter_x", "t1"."facebook", "t1"."email", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id", "t1"."birth_date", "t1"."client" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE ("t1"."is_active" AND (LOWER("t1"."location") IN ('london')))

question: Which employees report to managers in the Operations department?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."full_name", "t1"."department", "t1"."is_active", "t1"."reports_to_id" FROM "employees" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."reports_to_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (("t1"."is_active" = 1) AND ("t2"."is_manager" = 1) AND (LOWER("t2"."department") IN ('operations')))

question: Who has a birthday next week?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND (date("t1"."start_date") > date('now'))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-03-06') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-12')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-06') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-03-12'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-06') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-12')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%birthday%'))

question: How many employees do we have per location?
sql: SELECT "t1"."location", COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") AS "total" FROM "employees" AS "t1" WHERE "t1"."is_active" GROUP BY "t1"."location" ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") DESC

question: List all employees who work for the Apollo client.

question: Who is currently out of the office?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE ((((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ((date("t1"."start_date") <= date('now')) AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= date('now')))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-02-27'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%all types%')) AND ("t1"."status" = 'approved'))

question: Which employees are on vacation this week?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ((date("t1"."start_date") <= date('now')) AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= date('now')))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-05')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-03-05'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-05')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%vacation%'))

question: Who has scheduled time off for next month?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE ((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND (date("t1"."start_date") > date('now'))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-31')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-03-31'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-03-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-03-31'))))

question: List all employees who are on sick leave today.
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ((date("t1"."start_date") <= date('now')) AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= date('now')))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-02-27'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%sick%'))

question: Which employees have pending time off requests?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ("t1"."status" = 'pending'))

question: Who is taking annual leave during the Christmas holidays?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND (date("t1"."start_date") > date('now'))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-12-25') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-12-31')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-12-25') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-12-31'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-12-25') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-12-31')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%annual%'))

question: List all employees who took birthday leave last month.
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND (date("t1"."end_date") < date('now'))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-01-01') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-01-31')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-01-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-01-31'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-01-01') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-01-31')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%birthday%'))

question: How many people are out of office today across all departments?
sql: SELECT "t1"."policy_type", COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") AS "total" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE ((((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ((date("t1"."start_date") <= date('now')) AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= date('now')))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-02-27'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%out of office%')) AND ("t1"."status" = 'approved')) GROUP BY "t1"."policy_type" ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT "t1"."id") DESC

question: Which employees from the Design team are currently on leave?
sql: SELECT "t1"."id", "t1"."employee_id", "t1"."policy_type", "t1"."start_date", "t1"."end_date", "t1"."type", "t1"."status", "t1"."created_at", "t1"."updated_at", "t2"."id", "t2"."updated_at", "t2"."full_name", "t2"."nationality", "t2"."department", "t2"."is_manager", "t2"."location", "t2"."linkedin", "t2"."twitter_x", "t2"."facebook", "t2"."email", "t2"."is_active", "t2"."reports_to_id", "t2"."birth_date", "t2"."client" FROM "time_off" AS "t1" INNER JOIN "employees" AS "t2" ON ("t1"."employee_id" = "t2"."id") WHERE (((((("t2"."is_active" = 1) AND ((date("t1"."start_date") <= date('now')) AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= date('now')))) AND ((((date("t1"."start_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27')) OR ((date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") <= '2025-02-27'))) OR ((date("t1"."start_date") <= '2025-02-27') AND (date("t1"."end_date") >= '2025-02-27')))) AND (LOWER("t1"."policy_type") LIKE '%leave%')) AND ("t1"."status" = 'approved')) AND (LOWER("t2"."department") LIKE '%design%'))
